repo.name: secp256k1
repo.description: Optimized C library for EC operations on curve secp256k1

repo.name: secp256k1
repo.description: Optimized C library for EC operations on curve secp256k1

events.message: Move R from adaptor_proof to adaptor_sig and fix args of _adapt
Add dleq proof and dleq verify
Move dleq things in own file and add adaptor sign
Fix adaptor_sig_verify: should compare scalars and not fe's
Clean up docs and reenable tests
Make ecdsa_adaptor_sig_verify compare full points instead of only x coords
Add gen2 to dleq challenge and nonce function
Fix dleq tag by removing trailing NUL bytes
Fix not checking return value of dleq_proof in ecdsa_adaptor_sign
Fix dleq tag for challenge hash too
Fix not checking the return value of secp256k1_ge_set_xo_var
Return 0 in ecdsa_adaptor_extract_secret if the sigs are unrelated
Revise serialization to match latest spec

events.body:
This is really cool - thank you for taking it over.

The current consensus is that this library should focus on the demands of Bitcoin Core. Modules outside of that focus can go into the [libsecp-zkp fork](https://github.com/ElementsProject/secp256k1-zkp). I initially wrote this code on top of libsecp, because libsecp-zkp was not up-to-date with the most recent libsecp. But that's not the case anymore and we have mechanisms in place now to bring libsecp-zkp in sync. Therefore, I'd recommend to rebase on top of libsecp-zkp (which should be very straightforward) and open a PR there.
@jonasnick Thanks for the heads-up! I will re-open the PR in libsecp-zkp.
